headline: CrowdStrike CEO says AI agents are unpredictable as company snaps up more cybersecurity startups
summary: CrowdStrike has come out swinging in 2026 with some key deals. Here's why.

raw.headline: CrowdStrike CEO says AI agents are unpredictable as company snaps up more cybersecurity startups
raw.summary: CrowdStrike has come out swinging in 2026 with some key deals. Here's why.

headline: CrowdStrike defeats shareholder lawsuit over huge software outage
summary: A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit by CrowdStrike shareholders who said the cybersecurity company defrauded them by concealing its inadequate ​software testing and quality assurance procedures, before a July 2024 outage crashed more ‌than 8 million Microsoft Windows-based computers worldwide.  In a decision made public on Tuesday, U.S. District Judge Robert Pitman ‌in Austin, Texas said shareholders failed to plausibly allege that a large number of statements by CrowdStrike and top executives in regulatory filings, on earnings calls and on the company's website were materially false and misleading, or motivated by an intent to defraud.  Led by New York State ⁠Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli, the shareholders ‌alleged that CrowdStrike had "no test plans and no quality assurance team," citing former employees, and that executives at the Austin-based company prioritized "speed over ‍everything else" to maximize profit.

headline: CrowdStrike CEO on M&A: Identity security is the 'new perimeter'
summary: CrowdStrike (CRWD) has closed a deal valued at $420 million to acquire Seraphic Security; this comes after acquiring identity security platform SGNL last week for $740 million. CrowdStrike also bought Pangea and Onum in 2025. CrowdStrike Co-Founder and CEO George Kurtz joins Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi on Opening Bid to talk about the cybersecurity operator's goals to expand its identity security portfolio and the value these companies add to CrowdStrike. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: CrowdStrike to acquire Seraphic Security, terms undisclosed
summary: CrowdStrike (CRWD) announced it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire Seraphic Security. The purchase price is contemplated to be paid predominantly in cash and includes a portion to be delivered in the form of stock subject to vesting conditions. The proposed acquisition is expected to close during CrowdStrike’s first quarter of FY’27, subject to customary closing conditions. headline: CrowdStrike to acquire Seraphic Security for browser security boost
summary: The acquisition will boost CrowdStrike's Falcon platform by integrating Seraphic’s protection, enabling advanced security in popular browsers.
